data.title: Missions
data.body:
Added Difficulty (Normal & Hard) 
Added Music
Made Fixes

data.title: Missions
data.body: Made Fixes to Survival_01 Script.

data.title: [cnc] MachineGun, APCgun air/ground. Weapons tweaked
data.body:
Buffed MachineGun for Jeeps. Now identical to RA.Â 
(Default Humvee and Buggy are quite weak vs. infantry. This is meant to allow them to be useful in an anti-infantry role. They still remain balanced by being vulnerable to E3, tanks and vehicles)

APC gun can now shoot at ground and air.

Minor changes:
Airstrike and IonCannon tweaked to one-shot certain buildings (barracks & adv. power plant, respectively).
GrenadierExplode fixed.
Minor Housekeeping for Chemspray, some explosion sounds.

data.title: Allies 04: Players can infiltrate the lab more than once with spies trained at their base

data.title: Red Alert Allied AI adds (cammo) pillbox to its attacking force.
data.body:
In the version 20121019, the every Allied faction AI that builds any kind of pillbox adds it to its attacking force. So, once the first attack force fails, it doesn't attack the enemy again until the oldest pillbox (or two) are destroyed.

I believe it could be related to the fact that the pillbox structures have the 'e1' in its name, but I haven't checked the code to confirm it.

data.title: Stats ingame v2.0
data.body:
Its amazing, wishlist for next:
- [ ] Make the screen smaller when fewer players
- [x] after game stats
- [x] stats view when dead
- [ ] make it more transparent?
- [ ] combined team view, and team view also on all (line for teams in graph)
- [ ] fix for long player names.. (should be banned)
- [ ] afk icon for players

data.title: d2k what faction am I
data.body: When factions have special abilities, and user selected random, then somewhere it should read what faction you are.....

data.title: Stances AI
data.body: When playing Allies_01, Tanya seems to default to some stance other than "AttackAnything", which caused me some issues until I read the documentation and discovered how to change her stance.  But when I changed her to AttackAnything, she really does mean anything - There doesn't seem to be a stance where she scans for and attacks any _units_ within her attack range, but ignores _structures_.  The AttackAnything stance seems to consider buildings valid targets as well, which in addition to being a problem itself, also seems to break Tanya's multiple attack-types: When set to AttackAnything, she began wailing on the nearest power plant with her pistols, which she shouldn't be able to do to structures (except for those explosive oil drums).

data.title: Explosive Drums
data.body: When playing Allies_01, Tanya can't shoot the drums - it treats them like structures, that she has to walk up to and plant C4 on, which of course results in her fiery death.

Just some fixes on minor problems I came across on http://build.opensuse.org which enforces strict standards compliance:

- http://spdx.org/licenses/

data.title: Added New Maps/Missions
data.body:
Added Fixed Map Chaos Canyon.
Added Map Bad Neighbors.
Added Mission Survival_01.

data.title: Add strafing logic
data.body:
The original RA had logic in which the yak would instead of dumping all of its ammo in one spot, it would dump it in a line. We should add this feature into openRA, with the following features:

If targeting a unit, the strafing unit will first dump ammo on the tile the unit is on, and continue on.
If targeting a building, the strafing unit will first dump ammo on the occupied tile that the strafing unit is closest to.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/100103-add-strafing-logic?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Add EMP logic to Ion Cannon
data.body:
EMP logic was discussed back in 2011, back when pchote was on the team. I made the EMP effect SHP, which I still have. However, since pchote left the team, not much work has been done in C&C. Psydev is doing some stuff, but we need code work. We need the EMP logic added in, so we can add in the EMP Ion Cannon.

Here is what it should do:
Have an option to set an EMPed unit to a certain color or palette. (Such as black)
Apply an SHP to the EMPed unit or building.
Have an option to EMP Units, Buildings, Infantry, or all
This option should have exceptions (For example, an EMP weapon from RA might not hit infantry, but Volkov should be effected)

EMP effects should include the following options:
Buildings:
Slowing down/stopping production
Stopping or slowing down attacks
Stopping or slowing down special powers
Removing powered effects (such as Gap generation and stealth generation)

Vehicles/Infantry:
Stopping or slowing down the unit
Stopping or slowing down firing speed
Removing stealth
Destroying Ammo (for energy weapons, EMP would destroy the ammunition)

data.title: [CNC] Tanks now require Repair Bay as pre-requisite.
data.body:
Tanks now require Repair bay:
Made GDI Medium tank and Mammoth Tank require FIX.Â 
Made Nod Light Tank and Stealth Tank require FIX.

Not sure yet if Nod's Flame Tank should require Communications Center + FIX. Time will tell.

-Touched up palette build orders.
-Cleaned up the document (changed order of entries), for ease of editing.

data.title: [CNC] Helipad reduced to $1000. Palette order fixed.
data.body:
Helipad price reduced to $1000.Â Should make helicopter transports more accessible. Should also make having a few "support helis" flying around a more viable strategy, for non-standard builds.
Fixed palette order to be better grouped and in more progressive order.Â 
Re-arranged document so that it's sorted better.

data.title: [CNC] Chinook price reduced to $750
data.body:
Halved Chinook price, $1500 to $750.
Infantry should be a more feasible strategy, and transporting them quickly will make them more usable.
This should be good for Nod especially since they don't have APCs.

data.title: [CNC]  Buff machine gun. APC can shoot at ground now.
data.body:
Humvee and Nod Buggy get buff to their machine gun--it's now the same power as Jeep's in ORA.

APC gun now shoots at ground instead of just air. Reduced range from 7 to 5 as a result.
This should give a soft counter to enemy vehicles if the player decides not to play with tanks in the early game.Â

data.title: Check for ability to connect to the webserver before doing anything.
Don't try to upload packages if the build fails
IGNORETHIS
data.body: IGNORE THIS

data.title: Added a RA Classic Mod
data.body: As @hifi and others suggested this adds a mod to emulate the original gameplay. Basically what #2632 does but for Red Alert inspired by https://github.com/Iran/ClassicRA but merged back into mainline OpenRA making changes to the engine and rules transparent adding switches instead of hardcoding it. The conversion of rules.ini to yaml is copied from ClassicRA 0.1 release by @iran with minor tweaks to rebase it onto current bleed. Included are the unmerged pull request #2614 and #2602 as well as the official legacy maps converted by @dan9550 downloaded from http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=83&t=16139 Thanks to JOo for the interface reskin. The progress is discussed at http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=83&t=16023 as there is still some stuff to do like #2592 or #2058 up to changing the whole GUI layout back to http://redalert1.com as well as doing more research on original rules and behavior, but this is a good start for die-hard legacy fans to work upon and contribute.

data.title: Added a CnC classic mod
data.body: The goal of this mod is to have original game rules as reverse engineered by @Nyerguds and converted to yaml by @psydev. It uses old artwork by Harisson and @pchote and re-adds the slightly bit-rotted GDI01 single-player prototype with minor fixes. Included are the unmerged engine changes from pull request #2614 and #2602 as well as the maps converted by @dan9550 #2573.

data.title: [cnc-classic]  minor money changes
data.body:
Starting money now 5000 instead of 10,000 [default for C&C Gold]
Crates now give 2000 instead of 1000  [C&C Gold value, IIRC]
Warning audio (low power, silos needed) 20 seconds instead of 10.Â

data.title: [cnc-classic]  re-wrote infantry.yaml
data.body:
Unit values are now same as C&C Gold, including new unit dependencies.
(vision range is approximate, due to rendering differences for sight range)

data.title: [cnc-classic]  re-wrote structures.yaml
data.body:
Structures should now have same values C&C Gold now.Â 
Helipad is not perfect (unit does not spawn in the center)
There may be issues with how the ion cannon does damage differently to weapons factory vs. airfield (also an issue in regular CNC fork).
List of buildings has been organized from basic to advanced, and in-game build menu has been changed to be more logical.Â
